name: Paul Sauer 2011
description:
*‘Always close to the top of the red Bordeaux style pile in South Africa, Paul Sauer is one of a* *handful of wines that is collectible, partly because of its track record, but also because it ages so well. This blend of Cabernet with 18% Cabernet Franc and 12% Merlot is aged entirely in new oak, but you’d never know it, such is its grace and poise. Subtle, leafy, spicy and very fine. Drink: 2015-30.’*- Tim Atkin MW, SA Special Report 2015, 95/100


*‘Sense of place in this iconic flagship; richly vinous more than fruity, with supple muscularity. 2011 touch more aromatic in youth, with hint oak (new French); but firm underbelly, austere conclusion from its 70% Cabernet Sauvignon portends well for future. Cabernet Franc and Merlot complete blend.’* - Platter’s SA Wine Guide 2015, 4.5☆ 

 The wines will be cellared at Wine Cellar (Professional wine storage, Cape Town) vintage cellar until maturity (estimated 2028) or withdrawal.
